character.statement: If C.J. doesn't show up, I finally have a chance to win first prize!
I got it right five times in a row!
It's amazing, but true: if you rub a balloon on your hair, it'll stick to your head!
I wonder what else I could get to stick on my head?
C.J. told me she was going to do something really BIG for this year's science fair! But she wouldn'tt tell me WHAT!
I'm going to do the same project next year!
I hate how C.J. wins every year, but I always love seeing her science projects!
My project would have been much better if we'd been given more time to work on it.
Now I've got a whole year to think of something even better!

exchange.question: Who are you?
exchange.answer: I'm Mr. Silva, the science teacher.

exchange.question: Is everything all right?
exchange.answer: The science fair is about to start and my star pupil hasn't arrived!

exchange.question: Do you think she's just running late?
exchange.answer: She's won the science fair three years in a row. She wouldn't miss it for the world!

character.statement: I couldn't have done it without your help.
C.J. must be on her way. She plans her whole year around the science fair!
Thank you so much for helping our daughter.

exchange.question: Where is C.J.?
exchange.answer: I'm not sure, but she should be here soon.

exchange.question: What kind of project is she bringing?
exchange.answer: C.J. said she had an amazing project this year. She never let us in her room to see what she was working on!

exchange.question: Can I help with anything?
exchange.answer: Why don't you run over to our apartment and check on C.J. We live on Avenue A.

character.statement: I couldn't have done it with out you!
I couldn't have done it with out you!
